fields.description:
Currently, you may navigate to a user profile (from an issue, lets say), but if you are an administrator, and you want to modify this user (groups or whatever), then you have to go to the UserBrowser page and do a search.

If the current-logged-in user has jira-administrator priveleges, then there should be a link to "Admin User" - to the ViewUser action.

-Nick
fields.summary: In ViewProfile, add link to ViewUser if the logged-in user has jira-administrator priveleges

fields.description:
Why should the Jira Professional Users have to suffer for having only one of the "Jira Enterprise" features?

Selecting this - when there is only one of them is a little annoying..
fields.summary: Remove the annoying need to select the "Group" Radio when editing Permissions in permission scheme

fields.description:
My JIRA displays this footer:

This site is running on Atlassian JIRA with a free Open Source Project / Non-profit License (license details).
JIRA is an issue tracking and project managment application. Evaluate JIRA for your organisation.

I think it should really be "management" instead "managment".
fields.summary: embarrassing typo: managment

fields.description: When using the time tracking, the default if no descriptor is entered is minutes.  We don't track anything in minutes. The smallest meaningful measure is hour. Is there any way to make the default hour? Better yet, is there any way to completely remove the ability to enter values in minutes?
fields.summary: Minimum time periods are not configurable

fields.description:
Custom fields that are added that only apply to a certain issue type are lost when the issue type is changed.  For instance, if there is a custom field called "custom1" that is only listed for issues of type "bug", when the user enters values into that field AND changes the issue type to something else, the newly entered values in "custom1" are lost.

This is a somewhat tricky but perfectly feasible scenario.  Possible solutions:

- Warn the user when changing an issue's type if there are any custom fields that will be lost?
- Save the user's values before changing the issue type, even though those new values won't be visible in the new issue type view?
- Create a new issue with the new issue type (with a special relationship to the original issue) so the old values aren't lost?

Just some thoughts.
fields.summary: Type specific custom fields lost when issue type is changed

fields.description:
Currently, there is no easy way for working out which project has a given key.

Particularly, you may have an issue key for an issue in a project that you dont have Browse permission. But how do you know what project you need to get permissions to?

Can we include the project key alongside the Project name on the BrowseProjects page?

-Nick
fields.summary: Include Project key in Administration->Browse Projects page

fields.description:
We have many administrators (about one per project) and each of these administrators create users, reset passwords etc.

Now, the problem is that when they do this and Jira sends its emails out to the users (for new user / reset password emails) the user doesnt know which administrator did it -  in order to contact them when there is a problem. This information is missing from the email.

It would be better if the email contained some information as to which administrator (logged in user) performed the action that resulted in the email.

-Nick
fields.summary: Include Jira Administrator Name (and email address) in email

fields.description:
We have assigned the "Work On Issues" permission to "Current Assignee" for a project, via a separate permission scheme for this project.

When working with the issue, JIRA shows the link "Work Log:
Worked on this issue? Log work done.".

Clicking ont he link reveals the form nicely.  However, when the current assignee attempts to submit, JIRA reports: "Form Errors: 
You do not have permission to log work on issues in this project."
fields.summary: "Work On Issues" permission assigned to "Current Assignee" does not work

fields.description:
Multiple versions of Mozilla (Win32) crash when you try and print any full content view. This behaviour is consistant, and happens on (at least) the Firebird 0.6.1 and Mozilla 1.3.

I know this is most likely a gecko bug rather than a Jira problem, but I can't find the specific gecko bug on their bugzilla instance, and it is affecting Jira acceptance here.

fields.description:
In 2.5, having custom fields severly affects performance.  Components take 30 seconds to browse.  Issues take 10 seconds to open.

I will post an attachment with a sample database export.
fields.summary: custom fields affect performance in 2.5

fields.description: After upgrading 2.4.1 to 2.5b2, the Open Issues: Assigned to Me portlet on Dashboard filter only shows issues with Status Open or Reopened. Previously statuses Assigned and In Progress were also shown. The name of the portlet implies the previous behavior was correct.
fields.summary: Open Issues: Assigned to Me portlet filter is broken

fields.description: Would be nice to have the 'Projects' dropdown changed to a multselect list, as i would often like to run queries over multiple projects (ie often just want to check the entire bug database, bar one or two projects)
fields.summary: In Filter creation, have 'Projects' field as multi select

fields.description:
Jira currently has the ability to link issues together.
The links have a qualifier describing the type of link e.g. Blocker, Reference, ...

When viewing an issue you can see the "links" of all issues that are 1-node (or link) away.

What is missing is the hole picture.

A "Link Map" or something similar would be a great add-on and will give all project leads a better understanding of the "dependencies" in a given project.

Now since jira already has a great useability rating with all the well thought off icons/colors/etc. I suggest that the "link type" gets a new attribute "color" or even an "icon".

If you then construct a graphical view of the dependendy map, you can colorize the "lines" (links) between the Issue-Symbols. Adding even more information about the dependencies in your project.

I believe that once you start working on the graphical representation of the dependency map more ideas will come up.

As a sidenote... having a feature like that, will put jira in competition with every requirements engineering tool. Why? Because I have only seen dependency-maps in tools like Rational-Rose, CaliberRM, etc.
fields.summary: Graph link dependency map

fields.description:
jira won't work on sun one. i'm describing my attempt to install and configure.

jira sunone installation
========================
this describes installing jira 2.4.1 on sun one application server 7 using Oracle 9i.

0) follow atlassian install guide to configure jira for oracle.

1) configure the sun one instance's "server.policy" file as follows:
	1.1) add the following to 			domains/[domain]/[server]/config/server.policy":
	---------------------------------------------------------------------
	grant {
		permission java.security.AllPermission;
	};
	----------------------------------------------------------------------
	
	This basically just turns on all security permissions (e.g. write to 	filesystem, set system property) to avoid trouble with the server. 

2) add the jdbc driver to the server classpath
	2.1) hit the admin console at http://host:4848 and log in
	2.2) click on your server instance under "app server instances" in the 
	2.3) click on "JVM settings"
	2.4) click on "path settings"
	2.5) add the location of your tier 4 jdbc driver jar (e.g. 	ojdbc14.jar) under "classpath suffix". 

3) create oracle connection pool "jdbc/JiraOraclePool" on the admin console using these parameters:
	3.1) DataSource classname: 	"oracle.jdbc.pool.OracleDataSource"
	3.2) Transaction isolation: 	"serializable"
	3.2) Properties:
		3.2.1) "URL" 		"jdbc:oracle:thin:@host:port:sid"
		3.2.2) "user"		"username"
		3.2.3) "password"		"password"

4) create datasource "jdbc/JiraDS" using "jdbc/JiraOraclePool" on the admin console
	4.1) hit "jdbc/jdbc resources" and click new
	4.2) enter "jdbc/JiraDS" as jndi name
	4.3) select "jdbc/JiraOraclePool" from pool name combo box.

5) deploy as war file on the admin console
	5.1) click on "server instance"/applications/web apps/
	5.2) hit "deploy" and browse for war file.
	5.3) specify "context-root"


This happened
=============

When trying to access Jira it produces the following stracktrace on the server console. 

From what I read:
1) Jira uses SiteMesh's com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.util.Container class to do servlet container detection and thinks Sun ONE is Tomcat.

2) Looking into SiteMesh, this seems to be caused by trying to classload org.apache.jasper.runtime.JspFactoryImpl".

3) Sun ONE's servlet engine is indeed based on Tomcat (or is in fact? I don't know). The appserver runtime jar is full of tomcat classes anyway.

4) Based on this detection, JIRA then turns of transactions and the jdbc driver starts complaining. 

StackTrace
==========
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
INFO: CORE3282: stdout: 2003-10-20 14:16:45,070 WARN [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] Detected that you are  using Tomcat - turned off all transactions.

fields.description:
One of my users accidentally typed a space after their username when creating an account, "myuser ".

When I click their name in the user browser, the query is
?name=myuser

instead of the correct:
?name=myuser%20

As such, JIRA reports the user doesn't exist.

I suggest that users not be able to create usernames with leading or trailing whitespace.
fields.summary: Errors when username has trailing space character

fields.description:
The symptom is that when creating an issue, the reporter can not see any jira-users in the assigned to selection box.(can see only jira developers).

Action taken before creating this issue entry:
- Under the permissions setting for the associated project, in the entry for assignable user, jira-users has been added. The symptoms is unchanged.
- Under the permissions setting for the associated project, in the entry for assignable user, all associated groups has been removed including jira-developers. The symptoms is unchanged (can still see jira-developers).
fields.summary: When creating an issue, cannot see jira-users in the assign to dropdown

fields.description:
One of our users has asked if it would be possible to add more than one attachment.  This is partly convenience, partly because they get a mail every time the issue is updated.

Yahoo! have a good file upload page I think, where you can click an 'Add more than one file' button that takes you to a page with six upload dialog boxes.
fields.summary: Add ability to enter multiple attachments at once

fields.description:
Many dialogs related to Schemes trigger a 404 - page not found error.

Example: In the "Add Field Layout Scheme" dialog, after clicking "Add" I get the 404 error for the URL /secure/admin/ViewFieldLayoutSchemes.jspa. This should really be /jira-25b2/secure/admin/ViewFieldLayoutSchemes.jspa.

Same problem with copy, edit or deleting the scheme, and when associating field layout scheme to a project.
fields.summary: several 404 errors

fields.description: We just did a spot of pair programming here in the office and I was thinking to myself it'd be cool if that was identified inside Jira.  As well as issues being assigned to an individual, it'd be kinda cool if they could be assigned to a pair ( or group ) of people.
fields.summary: Pair Assignments

fields.description: RSS generation of issues is great, and I use it alot, but it'd also be cool to have an RSS feed for comments on an issue.  Linked from an issue item as well.
fields.summary: RSS feed generation for comments on an issue.

fields.description: maven tries to download hsqldb-1.7.1-patched.jar which isn't shipped.

fields.description:
Is there a way to print out an issue that will also print out all  of
the comments, work log, change history, etc?   

What I've done so far is bring up the issue, with say, the comment pane
showing and clicked on the "view printable" icon in the upper right. 
>From there, I click on the print button (browser) and get a printout. 
What I'd like now is a printout showing both the comments and work log
(the rest would be nice as well).

Thanks
Dennis
fields.summary: The printable "View Issue" page should display both comments and work log

fields.description:
I have a project with the Name "Büro Berlin" and a key "BÜROB".

After entering a bug for this project I get redirected to /jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=BÃœROB-3 .

When selecting this bug from the issue navigator then the url is /jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=BÜROB-3 . 

Both URLs work in MSIE 6.0. However I think they should be the same. 

And I think special characters, such as umlauts, must be properly encoded when using in an url, at least I have never seen umlaut characters in an url.

fields.description: perhaps a problem with localization?

fields.description:
I reinstalled JIRA last week using a MySQL database with the app running under Tomcat on RedHat 8.  This morning I noticed a couple of people had filed issues with no descriptions entered so I dug around a little and discovered that,
a) descriptions are no longer being displayed for any issues, old or new
b) the MySQL daatabase appear to contain all of the required
information, including the description.

I was trying to setup a project on Friday that only a certain type of user could see or edit and I'm wondering if I've managed to turn off the descriptions somehow and if so how do I get them to show up again??? (I've just looked and the description is viewable if you edit the issue)

We've just started using JIRA again and I'm trying to sell the idea to my managers so it'd be really nice if I could make it work ASAP.
fields.summary: Descriptions not showing on issue details page

fields.description: We try to deploy Jira for evaluation reasons and are on the verge to buy. Problem is, that there is no big load on the server, but creation of a new issue takes more that 3 seconds. Are there any hints available how to improve that?

fields.description:
Group with ampersand in name cannot be deleted.  Evidently JIRA isn't escaping the string before adding it to a URL string. This issue also affects user names.

The simplest fix is to do an XML export, and then do a search & replace for the string, and replace the '&' with 'and' or something innocuous.

fields.description:
Along with per-component owners, it would be nice to have per-component submission schemes as well.

Use case:  project has 2 components, A and B.  Only some people on the team may be assignable to issues in component A, while everyone is assignable to issues in component B.

Is there any hope for me if I open a feature request for this and and per-component owners on the Professional edition?  ;)

/secure/UserWatches!default.jspa 

It appears this this cannot be done with a saved filter

I guess, for completeness, you could also add a "My Votes" portlet.

I feel the Add Custom Field feature needs to be changed.  I have several projects running and when I add a Custom Field, my only options are all projects or a single project.  But some of the custom fields are valid for multiple projects but not all projects.  

Can you change this feature so we can select the projects to associate a Custom Field with?   Or add make it so we can hide the Fields we do not want to see per project instead of global?

fields.description: The new feature to reconfigure the columns in the issue navigator does not appear to work properly with custom fields.  If you choose to expose a custom field, then move it's position to the left, it then shows up, but as a column to the far right.
fields.summary: Column ordering does not work with custom fields on issue navigator configurator

fields.description:
When an issue is closed but still has a time remaining attached to it, it keeps being shown in the time tracking report for incomplete issues. Mayabe this is a feature rather than a bug, but I still find it rather confusing and sometimes annoying.

It would be a good thing if the estimated time remaining would automatically be set to zero when closing an issue as closed issues obviously won't be worked on anymore.
fields.summary: Closed issues still show up as incomplete in time tracking

fields.description:
I have recently added a custom field "Procon LE", i.e. for most issues there is no value. Now I have added that field as a new column in the issue navigator, and my logfiles are getting flooded with 

2003-10-23 16:59:26,698 ERROR [web.action.issue.IssueNavigator] Cannot find key ProCon LE

Mike confirmed on the user list that this is not an error and everything will behave fine. Hence the loglevel should be changed from ERROR to DEBUG, so that the logfiles don't grow rapidly while there isn't really any problem.
fields.summary: logfiles flooded after adding new custom field to issue navigator
Move Developer Workload Report to a dashboard portlet

fields.description:
We've run into a problem with the Edit Issues Permission.  Turning it on for Developers so they can edit there own Issues, also means they can edit other Reporter Issues, this breaks our security model.  Can you modify this so there is a 'Edit Report Created Issue' and a 'Edit All Issue' features?  This would allow us to control which editing we would like to turn on and who has those rights.

Thanks
fields.summary: Add levels to Edit Issues

fields.description:
JIRA installs correctly under WS per user notes and mail list

On first entry to an uninitialized DB, shows a blank screen instead of the expected setup screen

After excluding the sitemesh exclude directive per user comment:

<filter-name>sitemesh-exclude</filter-name>
<url-pattern>/secure/*</url-pattern>
</filter-mapping>

the application starts and behaves relatively correctly but with only partial display of portlets and no styling.

A screenshot is attached (if attachment enabled)
fields.summary: SiteMesh problems prevent WebSphere 5.0.2 Operation

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to create a dashboard layout and save it with a name and then allow users to select it as their dashboard.

I would like our development team to all use the same dashboard, the QA team to use a different dashboard and other people outside of development who browse through JIRA to have yet another dashboard.  It would be nice if I could create three dashboards like "Dev Dashboard","QA Dashboard", etc and then when you configure your dashboard you could select on of the predefined layouts.
fields.summary: Save, reuse and share Dashboards (like dashboard picklist)

fields.description:
on Page
/secure/admin/jira/EditDefaultDashboard!default.jspa
columns and buttons poorly labeled

generated by
\atlassian-jira\secure\admin\views\editdefaultdashboardconfig.jsp
which includes
\atlassian-jira/includes/panels/portal/configure_dashboard.jsp

line 5 has <webwork:text name="'configureportal.rightcolumn'"/>
which renders as:  configureportal.rightcolumn 
instead of something freindly like: Right column

are these suppose to be set in \atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\jira\web\action\Dashboard.properties ?

Or is a taglib declaration missing?
fields.summary: Configure Default Dashboard page Columns and Buttons poorly labeled

fields.description: I create a new field named resolution order, that is a number. I woul like to sort the results of a query by it, but I am not able to do that because the fils does not appear at the result.
fields.summary: Allow to add custom fields in reports

fields.description: On first use, I found it difficult to find the "create new issue" button, despite the fact that it was prominently displayed in the top bar. My first instinct was to browse to the project on which I wanted to log the bug (by clicking on the title in the summary), then stare for several minutes at the main view in the project page, where I found several actions, none of them to log a bug. Since it's an action relating to a specific project, I would recommend moving it closer to the other project actions.
fields.summary: Suggestion: move "create new issue" to project summary

fields.description:
on page
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
ADMINISTRATION ->  View Projects

generated by 
\atlassian-jira\secure\project\views\viewprojects.jsp

append
    <font size="1"> (<webwork:property value="string('key')" />) </font>

to the cell that displays the Project name (line 42, I think)

Trivial, I know, but the keys are displayed nowhere else on that page or in a list.  I've added this to our Jira, but I think this will help others with very little cost.
fields.summary: Add project key after project name on view projects page

fields.description:
There is a bug in JIRA 2.4.1, where the hsqldb database bundled with the Standalone distribution gets occasionally restarted in memory, as queries come and go.  This can potentially result in data loss.  Gory technical details to follow.

This issue arose in 2.4 when we had to switch from commons-dbcp 1.0 to JOTM (it being transaction-aware - and transactions being forced on us by an Ofbiz upgrade..). JOTM uses xapool, which expires open connections after a default period of 10 minutes.  Thus, despite the minimum size of the pool being 2, these connections would expire and close after 10 minutes.  When the last connection closed, the hsqldb Database object finds itself with no Java References pointing to it, so is marked for garbage collection.

However!  The shutdown-and-clean-up logic for hsqldb's Database object is in a finalize() method, so it is not executed immediately the last connection is closed.  If the JVM is lazy about garbage collection, then an unused Database object could be in a pending-shutdown state for a long time.  If during this time, another request comes in, a *new* Database object is created, which starts writing to the log file.  Then the JVM's garbage collector kicks in, triggering the finalize() method on the old Database object.  Being unaware of the new Database, the old one will go through its shutdown process, which involves optimizing the .script file by rewriting it as a series of INSERTs.  The new (current) Database is now completely inconsistent wrt. the .script file, and data loss results.

The solution we've implemented in 2.5 is to keep a guardian connection open to hsql, independent of the connection pool.  This stops hsql from ever being restarted and garbage-collected.
fields.summary: hsqldb continually restarts, potentially corrupting data

fields.description:
Consider two different projects with different permission schemes and issues from one that are lined to issues from the other. IF people have only access to one of these projects, they should not see linked issues to the prohibited project.
Currently this is not checked and thus when an unauthorized user clicks on the ID of the linked issues, he gets an issue not found error.
It is also not good practise to show the presence of projects that should remain hidden. In this case their presence 'bleeds' through.

fields.description:
One of our main users has asked if she can share a filter with more than one group.  We have the common pattern of user / developer / pm groups for each project, but some filters should be shared with all members of a group, or two of these groups.

Rather than create four more groups to cover all permutations (!), please can we allow filters to be shared with more than one group?

fields.description:
When using the CreateOrCommentHandler to create issues from email in a POP box, it is possible for some emails to get 'stuck', so they create a new JIRA issue(s) every time the POPService runs.

This happens when a user's mail client (here, Lotus Notes) tries to encode the filename field of the Content-Disposition: header, as described at http://www.mhonarc.org/~ehood/MIME/2047/rfc2047.html.  According to:

http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/FAQ.html#encodefilename

this is not MIME-compliant behaviour.  The attachment is saved with the base64-encoded name ('=?UTF-8?B?U291bmR...').  JIRA may throw an exception [1] when trying to parse the header, and on Windows, will throw another exception[2] when trying to save the attachment with an undecoded filename.

A partial workaround has been implemented for 2.5.  The filename is checked to see if it appears to be encoded (begins with '=?'), and if so, is decoded.  This avoids the second exception, but not the first (which I cannot replicate).

fields.description:
I suggest that a JIRA installation automatically perform a backup after a successful import.

I just transferred my data from a 2.4 installation to a 2.5b1 installation.  The import was successful but then a shutdown killed JIRA ungracefully which killed all the imported data.  (Incidentally, I think JIRA should withstand a system shutdown.  I guess I should make that another ticket.)

Now I need to reimport, but if I didn't have the original data anymore I'd be screwed.  I think it makes sense to backup right after import.
fields.summary: Backup immediately after import

We are considering buying Jira.  Is it possible to fix this bug?

fields.description:
I'm cleaning up some issues in our JIRA.  I go to Browse Project and click on one of the Components listed, to see its open issues.  I clicked through on one of them, added some comments & resolved it.  I'm left viewing the newly-closed issue's details.

So far, so good.  Next I want to return to the component's other issues to do the next one.  However, I don't see any easy way to get there.  Either I hit "Back" a number of times in the browser (which, since it's been through some form submissions, I'm wary of - don't want to repeat my comments unnecessarily) or I need to go via Browse Project and start over.

The component, of course, is already displayed on the screen.  The project field above it is a link to the "Browse Project" screen.  It would be nice if the Components field was similarly made into a link to the open issues for that component.
fields.summary: Link from issue details to component summary

Any idea why this happened.  Please contact me for more information if needed.

Thanks!

To replicate the issue, follow the steps in "environment".

This is currently causing quite a bit of chaos when not-so-computer-literate (management) peoples are trying to interact with email notifications that they are being sent, as they dont realise they are not logged in.
fields.summary: Clicking a link from an email while not logged in displays error

fields.description:
We have a lot of issues unassigned, and the first developer who is free starts work on a issue reported directly to him, or from the unassigned list if there is a more important issue.
It would be really nice to see issues for unassigned, and current user at once.
fields.summary: It would be really nice to specficy several Asignee options in filters
allow filter on issues "worked on by"

fields.description:
The 'Fix For Versions' field is missing when editing an issue.  The field is visible when creating the issue, but not when editing.  I've tried toggling the field visibility using the Issue Fields page in the Issue Settings section.  I've tried reseting to defaults, the behaviour still persists.  This is running the Standalone version of Enterprise Edition 2.4.1-#55 on MySQL as a service.

This is an absolute blocker for us.  I had hoped to transition from 2.3 to 2.4.1 this weekend.
fields.summary: 'Fix For Versions' field missing when editing an issue

fields.description:
We could do *lots* more in the Ant script to ease webapp installation:

 - Get the user to select a db type from a drop-down list, and have a
   @token@ in entityengine.xml that is replaced.
 - Download extra required jars for the user's server, with <get>
 - Prompt the user for database connection details, and:
   - auto-generate Tomcat/Resin/Jetty XML descriptors.
   - use collected db config details to ensure JDBC connection works.
   - create a clean database, and maybe a 'jira' user, using <sql>.

 - Install JIRA as a Windows service.
 - Fetch and run another Ant script from www.atlassian.com, which in turn
   downloads and applies hotfixes.
 - ...
fields.summary: Improve webapp installation by enhancing Ant script

fields.description:
We have an excellent product, but...
There is no way to select any fields on bug report??!
I just want a simple report with bug summary and description, but there seems to be no way to do it!
fields.summary: no way to select the fields on any bug report

fields.description:
I have created a filter that should sort issues on column "Resolution" (issues should be ASC sorted).

Result : issues are not sorted correctly. 

Clicking on the "Resolution" col and letting issues being sorted DESC shows up a correct result.

You can experiment this behaviour in Atlassian's "Jira internal tracking system" by choosing my private filter "2.5 Pro, All Tasks"
fields.summary: Sorting Navigator using "Resolution ascending"  doesn't sort issues correctly

fields.description:
Would it be possible to allow a more flexible input on the search page for the 'Created in previous' field?  For example, many teams here work on fortnightly timescales and would therefore like to a filter for all issues resolved in the previous fortnight for management meetings etc.  Perhaps the most obvious way would be to allow a freeform text field taking an entry in the same format as the work log field?

I found this idea discussed as a secondary point in another issue (linked), but there has been no movement so far so I thought I'd raise it as an issue in its own right.
fields.summary: Need a more flexible 'Created in previous' field on filter

fields.description: Allow the creation of repetitive issues, i.e. an issue that reflects a task that is repeated every now and then, e.g. a monthly task. The issue itself stays the same, only its due date changes.
fields.summary: Repetitive issues

fields.description: When adding an issue link type, Name, Outward Link Description, and Inward Link Description are required. However, from the EDit Link Type interface, none of these properties are required for Update.

fields.description:
I just imported some CSV data, which was *mostly* successful.  The issues were created just fine, but there were a few exceptions thrown.  I listed them here, along with a few other observations.  Let me know if I should split these up into separate issues.

0. I didn't see a way to import "component", or custom fields.

1. It wasn't clear to me that I needed to enter a userid in the "raisedby" (etc) columns; I discovered this by trial-and-error after entering a full name in there and watching it create a completely new user.

2. What is the "ReviewMtg" column?  The sample values of "4" and "8" don't shed any light on its purpose.

3. No mention was made in the CSV import documentation that you needed to change the projectID on the line below where you specify the location of the CSV file.  It's right there, of course, so maybe I should have seen it, but I didn't.  So after running the import once and seeing everything imported into the wrong database, I was a little confused, and ultimately had to restore the data from a backup.

Oh, and it also seemed strange to me to have to enter a database key (e.g. 10020) instead of a project ID (e.g. "FOO").  I had to go to the database directly to find the key.

The docs in question: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v2.4.1/csv_import.html

4. import_csv.jsp threw a JasperException, with the following root cause:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 3
	at org.apache.jsp.import_csv_jsp._jspService(import_csv_jsp.java:167)

5. It seems like each new created issue generated an e-mail to "email@email.com".  Where is it getting that erroneous e-mail address?

6. In Tomcat's stdout.log, it listed each new issue as it was created, but periodically gave me one of these exceptions: 2003-10-06 15:17:46,603 ERROR [atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem]
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.cacheProjectSchemes(AbstractSchemeManager.java:379)
        at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.getSchemes(AbstractSchemeManager.java:95)
        at com.atlassian.jira.notification.DefaultNotificationSchemeManager.getRecipients(DefaultNotificationSchemeManager.java:83)
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:99)
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:25)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:53)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:147)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:387)
